meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a mausoleum.
meanings.sent1: The old, mausolean building stood tall and solemn in the graveyard.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed a mausolean structure to honor the deceased.
meanings.sent3: The mausolean statue in the park seemed to watch over the trees and flowers.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes had a mausolean quality, deep and mysterious like ancient tombs.
meanings.sent5: The mausolean atmosphere of the museum made visitors feel reverent and reflective.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a mausoleum.
meanings.sent1: The mausolean gates marked the entrance to the burial site.
meanings.sent2: Visitors admired the mausolean architecture of the historical monument.
meanings.sent3: The mausolean music playing in the background added a somber tone to the event.
meanings.sent4: The mausolean silence of the cemetery was broken only by the rustling of leaves.
meanings.sent5: The mausolean inscriptions on the walls told stories of the past and honored the departed.

meanings.definition: A large, stately tomb or building housing tombs.
meanings.sent1: The mausolean was adorned with intricate carvings and statues.
meanings.sent2: The family gathered at the mausolean to pay their respects to their ancestors.
meanings.sent3: The mausolean loomed in the distance, a silent sentinel of the past.
meanings.sent4: The mausolean held the remains of kings and queens from centuries ago.
meanings.sent5: Visitors marveled at the grandeur of the mausolean, a testament to the lives once lived within its walls.
